summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview transcript from July 15, 2021, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons electronics technician at MCC New York. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 9-10, 2019, specifically regarding the malfunctioning of surveillance cameras in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and the events of that morning.

persons.name: Daniels
persons.role: Electronics Technician, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: The witness being interviewed, a BOP electronics technician at MCC New York who was responsible for maintaining cameras and communication systems. He discusses discovering camera recording failures on August 9, 2019, and responding to the body alarm on August 10.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose death is under investigation. Found unresponsive in his SHU cell on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Tay
persons.context: SIS technician who was in the video room on August 9-10, 2019. He had access to the recording room but did not go into the back room where the recorders were.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Officer present in the SHU when Epstein was found. He was inside the tier and helped move Epstein.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Officer present in the SHU when Epstein was found. She was outside the tier with a key and appeared disheveled and stressed after the incident.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Warden at MCC at the time. The witness provided phone logs to him after the incident.

persons.name: Columbo
persons.context: Medical PA who responded to the body alarm and worked on Epstein, applying the AED and providing medical assistance.

persons.name: Anderson-Lane
persons.context: Lieutenant who was present during the feeding of inmates in the SHU after the incident. Inmates made accusations toward her about not doing rounds.

persons.name: Beckwin
persons.context: Former facility manager mentioned by the witness. The witness discussed camera upgrade needs with him.

persons.name: Charles
persons.context: Former Associate Warden whom the witness discussed camera issues with.

connections.description: Daniels interacted with Tay, the SIS technician, to gain access to the video recorder room on August 9th.
Daniels reported camera and phone log issues to Warden N'Diaye after Epstein's death.
Both were correctional officers on duty in the SHU when Epstein was found. Inmates accused them of not doing rounds.
Daniels reported camera system failures and upgrade needs to Facility Manager Beckwin.
Daniels discussed camera issues and upgrade requirements with Associate Warden Charles.

events.title: Camera System Failure Discovered
events.description: Daniels discovers around 50-60 cameras, including most in the SHU, are not recording due to failed hard drives in the old analog system. He notifies a supervisor and plans to fix it the next day.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Body alarm activated around 6:33 AM in the SHU. Epstein found in his cell on L Tier. Officers cut him down, moved him to a stretcher, and began CPR. He was taken to medical and then to the hospital.

events.title: Inmate Accusations in SHU
events.description: After the incident, inmates in the SHU accused officers Thomas and Noel of killing Epstein by not doing their rounds all night.

events.title: FBI Investigation and Evidence Seizure
events.description: FBI agents interview Daniels about the camera system and seize all hard drives and the recording system. Only one camera (the 46-door camera outside 10 South) was recording.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview
events.description: DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a sworn interview with Daniels as part of the investigation into Epstein's death and surrounding circumstances.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
Video Recorder Room (within SIS office, third floor), MCC
La Guardia Community College, New York City
keyFacts: On August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death, approximately 50-60 cameras in the MCC, including nearly all cameras in the SHU, were not recording due to failed hard drives in an outdated analog system.
Only one camera in the SHU area (the '46-door' camera outside 10 South) was recording on August 9-10, 2019. The footage was grainy but usable.

Daniels, the electronics technician, discovered the recording failure around 1:00-2:00 PM on August 9th, notified a supervisor, and was told to go home and fix it the next day, which was standard practice at MCC.
Inmates in the SHU accused correctional officers Michael Thomas and Tova Noel of 'killing' Epstein by not doing their rounds all night.
The FBI seized all hard drives and the entire recording system the day after Epstein's death. The data was reportedly corrupt and unrecoverable.
